intro: Galium sancakense, commonly known as the Turkish bedstraw, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Turkey and the Caucasus. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its characteristic appearance.
